name: Curd Rice
description: A cooling rice dish mixed with yogurt and tempered with spices, perfect for hot days.
instructions: Mash cooked rice while warm with milk
Let it cool to room temperature
Mix yogurt and salt into the rice
Heat oil, add mustard seeds and let splutter
Add urad dal, fry until golden
Add green chilies, ginger, curry leaves, and asafoetida
Pour tempering over curd rice and mix
Garnish with coriander leaves and pomegranate seeds if available
Serve chilled or at room temperature

name: Tomato Rice
description: Flavorful rice cooked with tomatoes and aromatic spices.
instructions: Heat oil, add mustard seeds and chana dal
Add cashews and fry until golden
Add onions, green chilies, and curry leaves, saut√©
Add tomato puree, turmeric, and chili powder
Cook until oil separates
Add salt and mix well
Add cooked rice and mix gently
Cook for 2-3 minutes on low flame
Garnish with coriander leaves
Serve hot with raita or papad

name: Hyderabadi Biryani
description: Aromatic rice layered with marinated chicken, cooked in dum style.
ingredients: Whole spices (bay leaf, cardamom, cinnamon, cloves)
instructions: Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, half of mint and coriander, spices for 30 minutes
Boil rice until 70% cooked and drain
Deep fry sliced onions until brown and crispy
Heat ghee, add whole spices
Add marinated chicken and cook until 80% done
Layer half rice over chicken
Top with fried onions, remaining mint, coriander, and saffron milk
Add remaining rice as final layer
Cover tightly with aluminum foil and lid
Cook on high for 3 minutes, then on low flame for 25 minutes
Turn off heat, let it rest for 10 minutes
Open and serve hot with raita

name: Chicken Chettinad
description: Spicy chicken curry from Chettinad cuisine with aromatic spices and coconut.
instructions: Dry roast coriander seeds, fennel, red chilies, pepper, cumin, cloves, and cinnamon
Add coconut and roast until golden, grind to paste
Heat oil, add curry leaves and onions, saut√© until golden
Add ginger-garlic paste and fry for 2 minutes
Add tomatoes and cook until mushy
Add ground spice paste and fry for 5 minutes
Add chicken pieces and mix well
Add salt and 1 cup water
Cover and cook until chicken is tender
Simmer until gravy thickens
Serve hot with rice or roti

name: Fish Fry Kerala Style
description: Crispy fried fish marinated with Kerala spices and curry leaves.
instructions: Clean fish and make slits on both sides
Mix all spices, ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, and salt
Add crushed curry leaves to marinade
Marinate fish for 30 minutes
Coat fish pieces with rice flour
Heat oil in a pan
Fry fish on medium heat until crispy and golden
Turn carefully and fry other side
Drain excess oil on paper towels
Serve hot with lemon wedges

name: Avial
description: A traditional Kerala mixed vegetable curry with coconut and yogurt.
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (drumstick, carrot, beans, raw banana, yam)
instructions: Cut all vegetables into long thin pieces
Cook vegetables with turmeric and salt until tender
Grind coconut, green chilies, and cumin to coarse paste
Add ground paste to cooked vegetables
Mix well and cook for 5 minutes on low flame
Turn off heat and add whisked yogurt
Mix gently without boiling
Heat coconut oil, add curry leaves
Pour over avial and mix
Serve with rice

name: Mysore Pak
description: A rich, melt-in-mouth sweet made with gram flour, ghee, and sugar.
instructions: Sieve besan to remove lumps
Heat 1/4 cup ghee, add besan and roast on low heat until aromatic
Meanwhile, make sugar syrup with water until one-string consistency
Add roasted besan to sugar syrup gradually while stirring
Keep stirring and add remaining ghee little by little
Mix continuously until mixture froths and leaves sides of pan
Add cardamom powder
Pour into greased tray immediately
Let it cool for 10 minutes and cut into pieces
Store in airtight container

name: Payasam
description: A creamy South Indian dessert made with rice, milk, and jaggery.
instructions: Wash and soak rice for 30 minutes
Cook rice in 2 cups milk until very soft and mushy
Add remaining milk and cook until creamy
Add jaggery and cook until dissolved
Add coconut milk and cardamom powder
Heat ghee, fry cashews and raisins
Add to payasam along with saffron
Simmer for 5 minutes
Serve warm or chilled

name: Puliyogare (Tamarind Rice)
description: Tangy tamarind rice with a special spice mix and crunchy peanuts.
instructions: Soak tamarind in water and extract thick juice
Heat oil, fry peanuts and set aside
Add mustard seeds, chana dal, urad dal
Add dry chilies and curry leaves
Add tamarind extract, turmeric, and asafoetida
Add puliyogare powder and salt
Cook until oil separates and raw smell goes
Add peanuts and mix
Cool the mixture completely
Add to cooked rice and mix gently
Serve with potato chips or appalam

name: Appam
description: Soft, spongy rice pancakes with crispy edges, a Kerala specialty.
instructions: Soak rice for 4 hours
Grind rice with coconut to smooth batter
Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water
Add to batter and mix well
Ferment for 8 hours or overnight
Add salt and adjust consistency
Heat appam pan and grease lightly
Pour a ladleful of batter and swirl to spread
Cover and cook until edges turn crispy and center is soft
Serve hot with vegetable stew or coconut milk
